resources.string:
OpenSeizureDetector does not collect any personal data. This does mean that it is not possible for me to contact users if I find an issue with the app that you should be aware of. 
Please subscribe to updates at http://openseizuredetector.org.uk, or the app Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/openseizuredetector. so I can get in touch if necessary.
Thank you! Graham 
graham@openseizuredetector.org.uk 

Changes in this version: 
 V3.2.0 - mar2020 
 - Modified data logging to use sqlite database rather than text files. 
 - Added facility to upload data to remote server. 
 - Added support for additional GarminSD settings data fields to record the watch app version number etc and log that info to the SysLog file. 
 - Made only a subset of settings visible by default unless the user enables Advanced Mode 
 V3.1.15 - Added German Language Support to main and start-up screens 
 V3.1.14 - Repaired OpenSeizureDetector Web Interface, that was broken by V3.1.13 
 V3.1.13 - Fixed ERR-400 display on garmin watch and associated problem with network datasource fault alerting.

OpenSeizureDetector does not collect any personal data. This does mean that it is not possible for me to contact users if I find an issue with the app that you should be aware of. 
Please subscribe to updates at http://openseizuredetector.org.uk, or the app Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/openseizuredetector. so I can get in touch if necessary.
Thank you! Graham 
graham@openseizuredetector.org.uk 

Changes in this version: 
 V3.2.0 - mar2020 
 - Modified data logging to use sqlite database rather than text files. 
 - Added facility to upload data to remote server. 
 - Added support for additional GarminSD settings data fields to record the watch app version number etc and log that info to the SysLog file. 
 - Made only a subset of settings visible by default unless the user enables Advanced Mode 
 V3.1.15 - Added German Language Support to main and start-up screens 
 V3.1.14 - Repaired OpenSeizureDetector Web Interface, that was broken by V3.1.13 
 V3.1.13 - Fixed ERR-400 display on garmin watch and associated problem with network datasource fault alerting.
Sorry, OpenSeizureDetector Has Crashed. Please Email this log file to us so we can work out what happened and fix it.\nThanks, Graham.

Dear OpenSeizureDetector,

Application is just crashed, please check following error log for more details.
OpenSeizureDetector (Using UCE Handler\nCopyright Â© 2018 Rohit Sahebrao Surwase.)
Enable Advanced Settings (exposes a lot more things you can change....)
Auto start OpenSeizureDetector when phone is started
Select whether to use a Garmin Watch, Pebble Watch or network connection as the seizure detector data source.
Log Data to Central OpenSeizureDetector Database
Use mobile internet to log remote data
Alarm Ratio Threshold (Default = 50). Increase to reduce sensitivity.
Treat a Null heart rate as an alarm condition
